alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 8:33PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...BANKFULL CONDITIONS FOR SOME RIVERS AND STREAMS ACROSS UPPER LYNN CANAL... Very warm temperatures across the region from late June through early July prompted bankful conditions in some area rivers and streams. This may cause some periodic impacts along the lower Taiya River near the Chilkoot Trail and along the Chilkat River northwest of Haines through Wednesday evening. Hikers on the Chilkoot Trail should note that water could periodically begin to inundate the trail with water through Wednesday evening. For the Chilkat River, areas around mile post 14 and 16 of the Haines Highway are the most likely places to experience minor flooding should it occur. Temperatures will drop to more normal levels late this week allowing river levels to drop as well. For Chilkat River at Klukwan: At 8:00pm the stage was 126.25 feet. Flood Stage is 128.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 126.7 feet is expected around 10:00am Wednesday. River levels should begin to fall more noticeably thereafter. Impacts: At 127.0 feet: This is bankfull stage, but water can encroach the Haines Highway, south of Klukwan. Note that the Chilkat River is highly braided, if and when it shifts channels, our present bankfull and flood stages will be outdated. ... For Taiya River near Skagway: At 8:00pm the stage was 15.97 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 16.3 feet is expected around 10:00pm Tuesday with another similar crest around 10pm Wednesday. Impacts: At 16.1 feet: Portions of the Chilkoot Trail begins to inundate with water.

area.areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway
